intro: Grumilea patens, commonly known as the slender grumihua, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Grumilea patens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils in full sun.
